sen.j: 日野事件（ひのじけん）とは、昭和26年（1951年）10月18日に、滋賀県蒲生郡日野町 (滋賀県)で発生した公安事件。
sen.e: Hino incident is an incident involving public safety, which took place in Hino-cho, Gamo-gun, Shiga Prefecture in 1951.
Hino incident is an incident involving public safety, which took place in Hino-cho, Gamo-gun, Shiga Prefecture on October 18, 1951.
sen.cmt: 日付が抜けていたので追加しました。
sen.e: Hino incident is an incident involving public safety, which took place in Hino-cho, Gamo-gun, Shiga Prefecture on October 18, 1951.

sen.j: 1951年10月18日午前11時30分、滋賀県蒲生郡桜川村（現・東近江市）に、在日朝鮮統一民主戦線や祖国防衛隊 (在日朝鮮人団体)のメンバーが集結し、自転車にスピーカーを取り付けて自転車デモを行おうとした。
sen.e: At half past eleven in the morning of October 18, 1951, some of the members of the Democratic Front for Unification of Koreans in Japan and the Homeland Defense Corps (which is a Korean resident organization in Japan) gathered in Sakuragawa-mura village (present Higashiomi City), Gamo-gun, Shiga Prefecture and tried to stage a demonstration by bicycles attached with a speaker.

sen.j: 滋賀県公安条例の届出を出していない違法デモであった。
sen.e: It was an illegal demonstration as no prior notification was made, which was required under the Public Safety Regulations of Shiga Prefecture.
It was an illegal demonstration as no prior notification was made, which was required under the Public Safety Regulations of Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 国家地方警察滋賀県本部蒲生東地区警察署では、これを制止しようとしたが強行突破し、日野町内に侵入した。
sen.e: The Gamo-Higashi District Police Station of the then National Rural Police Shiga Prefecture Headquarters tried to stop the demonstration in vain, and the demonstration members intruded into the town of Hino-cho.

sen.j: それから日野郵便局前で「朝鮮人強制送還反対」「軍事基地化反対」などの演説を行った。
sen.e: The members then made speeches in front of Hino Post Office expressing their objections to the 'deportation of Koreans', 'Japan's becoming a military base', etc.
sen.cmt: 「軍事基地化反対」は「どこが軍事基地と化するのに反対なのか」という点が欠落しており、推測で「日本の軍事基地化」と補足してあります。
sen.e: The members then made speeches in front of Hino Post Office expressing their objections to the 'deportation of Koreans', 'Japan's becoming a military base', etc.

sen.j: その間、周辺在住の在日コリアンが集まり、ピケを張ったりバリケードを作ったりした。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the Korean residents living in the nearby area gathered to establish a picket line and put up a barricade.

sen.j: そして、警官隊に向かって投石したり、棍棒で襲い掛かったり、拳銃を奪ったりしたので、公務執行妨害罪で20人を検挙した。
sen.e: They threw stones at the police squad, attacked the police officers with a club and snatched their pistols, and so 20 people were arrested for obstructing official duties.
